sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
**Perception of the Problem**



Right now, monitoring on-chain events in the Cardano ecosystem is clunky, resource-heavy, and fragmented. Developers must either:



- Run a full Cardano node + cardano-db-sync or cardano-graphql to poll addresses and filter events.
- Rely on third-party APIs (Blockfrost, Koios, Tangocrypto) and write custom polling code.
- Pay for webhook services that are centralized, have pre-set limitations, and are often closed-source.

**All three have trade\-offs:**



- Running a node demands constant maintenance and infrastructure.
- Polling wastes resources and risks missing events.
- Paid services create vendor lock-in and limit innovation.



No open-source tool exists today that lets developers (or even non-coders) set custom, human-readable rules for blockchain event triggers and receive instant notifications without coding.



**Proposed Solution**



We will create Cardano AI Wallet Alerts, an open-source, AI-powered event trigger framework. It will allow users to simply:



- Input a Cardano wallet address or multiple addresses.
- Type a plain-language instruction (e.g., “Notify me on Discord when wallet addr1... receives more than 200 ADA within 1 hour” or “Email me when my smart contract at policy xyz is spent”).
- Select a notification method (email, Discord, Slack, webhook, Telegram, etc.).

**The AI will:**



- Parse the natural-language rule into precise blockchain event conditions.
- Automatically configure the backend to monitor for these events via an indexing API (Blockfrost/Koios) or light-weight listener.
- Trigger the notification instantly when the event occurs.
- The core innovation: This removes the need for polling code, manual GraphQL queries, or vendor-locked webhook setups, while being open, transparent, and extensible for the community.

**Why This Approach**



We chose this architecture because it bridges two currently separate worlds:



Event-driven blockchain listening (usually dev-only, code-heavy).

Natural language task creation (AI translating plain English to machine logic).

This allows both developers (who can extend and integrate the SDK) and non-developers (who just want alerts) to use the same open-source framework.



**Who We Will Engage**

- 
- Developers: They’ll gain an extensible SDK/CLI to set event triggers programmatically and integrate into dApps, bots, or monitoring systems.
- Community members: Non-technical users can create alerts through a web UI without touching code.
- Businesses/Projects: Treasury managers, NFT projects, staking pools, and DeFi platforms needing automated responses to wallet events.

Proof of Impact



We will track:



Number of rules created by users.

Number of unique active wallets monitored.

Time-to-notification performance metrics.

Community contributions (forks, pull requests).

Adoption by dApp developers integrating our framework.

Additionally, the repo will be public from day one, enabling measurable collaboration and transparency.

Uniqueness



Natural Language to Trigger Rules: no existing Cardano solution does this in open-source form.

Multi-notification channel support: not just webhook or email, but Discord, Telegram, etc.

Fully open-source: no closed APIs, no paid tier limitations.

Extensible architecture: anyone can add new trigger types.

Why This Matters for Cardano



Cardano thrives when developers can build quickly and community members can interact with the chain without friction. Our tool:



Lowers technical barriers for real-time blockchain monitoring.

Encourages open innovation (any dev can fork, extend, or integrate).

Reduces dependence on closed, centralized services for event triggers.

Strengthens Cardano’s open-source ecosystem in line with the Cardano Open fund’s mission.

We’re not just solving a single problem, we’re enabling a whole class of automated, event-driven dApps and user experiences from DeFi liquidation alerts to NFT minting trackers, in a way that’s free, community-owned, and future-proof.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
Our project will make real-time wallet event detection accessible to every Cardano developer, removing the need for heavy node setups or paid closed-source services. By enabling instant, no-code trigger creation, we lower the barrier to building responsive dApps, payment processors, governance tools, and DeFi protocols.



**Measuring Impact:**



Quantitative: GitHub stars, forks, contributions, release downloads, SDK/CLI installs, webhook events triggered, and active projects using the framework.



Qualitative: Developer feedback via surveys, Discord, and the Cardano Forum; case studies from projects integrating our tool.



**Sharing Outputs**



We will share all code, documentation, and updates in a public GitHub repo from day one, post tutorials and walkthroughs on the Cardano Forum, present updates at Cardano developer meetups, and create YouTube demos showing real-world use cases. This ensures global access and active adoption across the Cardano ecosystem.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
Cardano AI Wallet Alerts will be developed as an open-source, event-driven monitoring framework built with a modular architecture for scalability, extensibility, and developer adoption.



**Technical Feasibility**



- Blockchain Data Access: Integration with Koios API ([https://api\.koios\.rest/\)](https://api.koios.rest/)) and Blockfrost API ([https://blockfrost\.io/\)](https://blockfrost.io/)) to index wallet activity without requiring a local node. Optional node integration for advanced users.
- AI Natural Language Processing: Python backend with FastAPI ([https://fastapi\.tiangolo\.com/\)](https://fastapi.tiangolo.com/)) using OpenAI’s GPT-based parsing for translating plain English into executable blockchain event filters.
- Event Detection: WebSocket and subscription-based architecture to avoid inefficient polling.
- Latency target: 5 seconds from event occurrence to notification.
- Notification Layer: Multi-channel support — email, Discord, Slack, Telegram, and webhooks via Twilio and Firebase Cloud Messaging.
- Security: No private keys handled; wallet addresses only. Adherence to CIP-003 and CIP-95 ([https://cips\.cardano\.org/\)](https://cips.cardano.org/))



**Delivery Capability**



- I have extensive blockchain and backend development experience, specifically in event-driven architectures and Cardano-specific tooling.
- As a Delegated Representative (dRep) for the Cardano Africa Academy, I’m deeply embedded in Cardano governance and technical discourse.
- I have reviewed and assessed proposals in Project Catalyst since Fund 10, giving me insight into what constitutes deliverable, realistic, and ecosystem-aligned solutions.

Past Contributions Community Work



- Cardano Africa Academy dRep representing African perspectives in Cardano governance.
- Guest speaker at Cardano developer onboarding events in Ghana: slides ([https://drive\.google\.com/file/d/1lfBpfcvpXq\-nWcqQ26\_\-DbgvlTNDvtVD/view?usp=sharing\)](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1lfBpfcvpXq-nWcqQ26_-DbgvlTNDvtVD/view?usp=sharing)) | event media ([https://drive\.google\.com/drive/folders/1OZ59wk64RUOnOZScFY\-jiRO31SrifE\_J?usp=sharing\)\.](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1OZ59wk64RUOnOZScFY-jiRO31SrifE_J?usp=sharing).)

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
The Cardano AI Wallet Alerts project delivers exceptional value by providing a real-time, AI-powered, open-source monitoring tool that addresses one of the biggest gaps in the ecosystem: timely, customizable blockchain notifications for both technical and non-technical users.



Why this is a good use of funds:



Direct Ecosystem Utility: This tool empowers developers, stake pool operators, DeFi projects, NFT marketplaces, and end-users with instant alerts on wallet transactions, stake changes, token transfers, or smart contract triggers, improving transparency, reducing risk, and increasing trust.

Infrastructure for Builders: By releasing an SDK and API under a permissive MIT/Apache license, we provide infrastructure that other Cardano projects can integrate directly into their apps without vendor lock-in. This compounds the value of Catalyst’s investment over time.

Cost Efficiency:



Developer and AI engineer rates budgeted at 35–45 USD/hour are in line with industry averages for Africa-based and remote blockchain developers, which is significantly lower than Western freelance rates (often $70–120/hour).

Cloud infrastructure costs are minimized by using scalable, pay-as-you-go providers like AWS, Supabase, or Cardano-specific indexers like Koios, instead of expensive fixed hosting.

Marketing and adoption efforts are targeted toward existing Cardano community hubs (e.g., Cardano Forum, Discords, Twitter Spaces) rather than high-cost broad campaigns.

Open-Source Multiplier Effect: The budget is not just funding a single product it funds reusable code, developer documentation, and an open standard for wallet event notifications that can be built upon indefinitely without further Catalyst funding.

Proportionality of Costs:



The 120,000 ADA request covers 100% of required expenses with no hidden shortfall.



Milestone-based disbursement ensures Catalyst only pays when verifiable progress is delivered.



Similar scope blockchain alerting systems like Ethereum and Solana cost $90–100k to develop, making this proposal 40–50% cheaper while remaining feature-competitive.



By combining strategic technical investment, ecosystem-wide accessibility, and open-source development, this project delivers far more than a single product, it creates a foundational layer that strengthens Cardano’s utility, resilience, and attractiveness to builders and users alike.
